trans-unit.source: List Map Operations - Usage and Examples
trans-unit.target: List Map Operations - Usage and Examples

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the List Map Operations available in <token>af_integration_full</token>:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the List Map Operations available in <token>af_integration_full</token>:

trans-unit.source: Creates and initializes a List that can:
trans-unit.target: Creates and initializes a List that can:

trans-unit.source: Be used for complex structure transformations
trans-unit.target: Be used for complex structure transformations

trans-unit.source: Contain other container <token>mapop</token>s, including ForEach Loop and MapEach Loop.
trans-unit.target: Contain other container <token>mapop</token>s, including ForEach Loop and MapEach Loop.

trans-unit.source: A List is like a table.
trans-unit.target: A List is like a table.

trans-unit.source: A List has a set of <legacyBold>Members</legacyBold> (like columns in table) and a set of <legacyBold>Items</legacyBold> (like rows in a table).
trans-unit.target: A List has a set of <legacyBold>Members</legacyBold> (like columns in table) and a set of <legacyBold>Items</legacyBold> (like rows in a table).

trans-unit.source: Member Name: Add the members of the List.
trans-unit.target: Member Name: Add the members of the List.

trans-unit.source: Member Type: Click the type of the Member Name: String, Number, or Boolean.
trans-unit.target: Member Type: Click the type of the Member Name: String, Number, or Boolean.

trans-unit.source: Use the <embeddedLabel>Add Item to List</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to add an item to the List.
trans-unit.target: Use the <embeddedLabel>Add Item to List</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> to add an item to the List.

trans-unit.source: Every <token>mapop</token> within the Create List container should contribute on the path towards <legacyBold>Add Item to List</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Every <token>mapop</token> within the Create List container should contribute on the path towards <legacyBold>Add Item to List</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: <token>mapop</token>s that create target tree nodes (like MapEach and Conditional Assignment) are not allowed within the Create List scope container.
trans-unit.target: <token>mapop</token>s that create target tree nodes (like MapEach and Conditional Assignment) are not allowed within the Create List scope container.

trans-unit.source: Adds an item to the list.
trans-unit.target: Adds an item to the list.

trans-unit.source: Use <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> in the container of the Create List <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: Use <legacyItalic>only</legacyItalic> in the container of the Create List <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Can have at least 0 input parameters:
trans-unit.target: Can have at least 0 input parameters:

trans-unit.source: A Member in a Create List or a link.
trans-unit.target: A Member in a Create List or a link.

trans-unit.source: An expression to conditionally add items to the List.
trans-unit.target: An expression to conditionally add items to the List.

trans-unit.source: Can also be a link from a Logical Expression <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: Can also be a link from a Logical Expression <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Results in an Item added to the <legacyBold>Add Item To List</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: Results in an Item added to the <legacyBold>Add Item To List</legacyBold> <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Each group is identified by a unique value of the selected members.
trans-unit.target: Each group is identified by a unique value of the selected members.

trans-unit.source: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Member to include in the output.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Member to include in the output.

trans-unit.source: If one Member is specified, the List is one Group for each unique Member value.
trans-unit.target: If one Member is specified, the List is one Group for each unique Member value.

trans-unit.source: If multiple Members are specified, the List-of-Groups will contain a Group for each unique combination of the Members value.
trans-unit.target: If multiple Members are specified, the List-of-Groups will contain a Group for each unique combination of the Members value.

trans-unit.source: A List containing a single Group or List-Of-Groups based on the Member value.
trans-unit.target: A List containing a single Group or List-Of-Groups based on the Member value.

trans-unit.source: Selects the first item In a List.
trans-unit.target: Selects the first item In a List.

trans-unit.source: If a condition is specified, the first item in the list matching the condition is selected.
trans-unit.target: If a condition is specified, the first item in the list matching the condition is selected.

trans-unit.source: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select List Member: Select the member in the list to return.
trans-unit.target: Select List Member: Select the member in the list to return.

trans-unit.source: An expression to conditionally select items from the List.
trans-unit.target: An expression to conditionally select items from the List.

trans-unit.source: An expression to conditionally select items from the List.
trans-unit.target: An expression to conditionally select items from the List.

trans-unit.source: Accesses the value of the selected List Member and returns its value.
trans-unit.target: Accesses the value of the selected List Member and returns its value.

trans-unit.source: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: A link to a Create List <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: A constant or link can also be added.
trans-unit.target: A constant or link can also be added.

trans-unit.source: Specify the member to include in the output.
trans-unit.target: Specify the member to include in the output.

trans-unit.source: If no members are specified, the output is not filtered by member.
trans-unit.target: If no members are specified, the output is not filtered by member.

trans-unit.source: An expression to conditionally filter items from the List.
trans-unit.target: An expression to conditionally filter items from the List.

trans-unit.source: Used in a ForEach or MapEach Loop.
trans-unit.target: Used in a ForEach or MapEach Loop.

trans-unit.source: Gets the item in the list of the current iteration.
trans-unit.target: Gets the item in the list of the current iteration.

trans-unit.source: When iterating over Unique Groups generated from a list, it returns the current group's items.
trans-unit.target: When iterating over Unique Groups generated from a list, it returns the current group's items.

trans-unit.source: Order By creates a new List.
trans-unit.target: Order By creates a new List.

trans-unit.source: It does not modify the input List.
trans-unit.target: It does not modify the input List.

trans-unit.source: The input List can still be used in other operations; these items are in a different order than the List returned by the Order By map operation.
trans-unit.target: The input List can still be used in other operations; these items are in a different order than the List returned by the Order By map operation.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, Items in the List are sorted by the first specified Member.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, Items in the List are sorted by the first specified Member.

trans-unit.source: A tie between Items is resolved by comparing the second Member, and so on.
trans-unit.target: A tie between Items is resolved by comparing the second Member, and so on.

trans-unit.source: After the link is created, choose the Member to sort.
trans-unit.target: After the link is created, choose the Member to sort.

trans-unit.source: Returns a sorted list by the Member specified.
trans-unit.target: Returns a sorted list by the Member specified.

trans-unit.source: In the following examples, the All_Employees List contains four members: Emp_Id, Name, Designation, and Age.
trans-unit.target: In the following examples, the All_Employees List contains four members: Emp_Id, Name, Designation, and Age.

trans-unit.source: The All_Employees List has six Items:
trans-unit.target: The All_Employees List has six Items:

trans-unit.source: Using the Name Member and specifying a Condition:
trans-unit.target: Using the Name Member and specifying a Condition:

trans-unit.source: Using the Emp_ID, Name and Age Members and specifying a Condition:
trans-unit.target: Using the Emp_ID, Name and Age Members and specifying a Condition:

trans-unit.source: You connect the All_Employees List to a MapEach Loop.
trans-unit.target: You connect the All_Employees List to a MapEach Loop.

trans-unit.source: This results in six iterations of the MapEach’s body.
trans-unit.target: This results in six iterations of the MapEach’s body.

trans-unit.source: To access each individual Item in the All_Employees List, use a <embeddedLabel>Get Items</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.
trans-unit.target: To access each individual Item in the All_Employees List, use a <embeddedLabel>Get Items</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token>.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, <embeddedLabel>Get Items</embeddedLabel> returns a <legacyItalic><legacyBold>List containing a single Item</legacyBold></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, <embeddedLabel>Get Items</embeddedLabel> returns a <legacyItalic><legacyBold>List containing a single Item</legacyBold></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: This single Item is the current iteration variable.
trans-unit.target: This single Item is the current iteration variable.

trans-unit.source: You can then use a <embeddedLabel>Select Value</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> (without a Condition) to select a specific Member of this Item.
trans-unit.target: You can then use a <embeddedLabel>Select Value</embeddedLabel> <token>mapop</token> (without a Condition) to select a specific Member of this Item.

trans-unit.source: Using the Designation and Age Members:
trans-unit.target: Using the Designation and Age Members:

trans-unit.source: When Create List is added to the <token>transform</token> design area, a scope container is created.
trans-unit.target: When Create List is added to the <token>transform</token> design area, a scope container is created.

trans-unit.source: All <token>mapop</token>s added to the container execute in the scope of that Loop container.
trans-unit.target: All <token>mapop</token>s added to the container execute in the scope of that Loop container.

trans-unit.source: For details on working within the scope container, see <link xlink:href="4a57af82-cae8-412d-a066-fb6a766d0be1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Working within the Scope</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details on working within the scope container, see <link xlink:href="4a57af82-cae8-412d-a066-fb6a766d0be1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Working within the Scope</link>.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> provides the ability to configure how an error is handled and how an empty or null node is handled.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> provides the ability to configure how an error is handled and how an empty or null node is handled.

trans-unit.source: The error handling behavior of the following <ui>List</ui> <token>mapop</token>s is configurable:
trans-unit.target: The error handling behavior of the following <ui>List</ui> <token>mapop</token>s is configurable:

trans-unit.source: Open a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> or the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vsprvs</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open a <ui><token>msgflow_proj</token></ui> or the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service Artifacts</embeddedLabel> project in <token>vsprvs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Double-click a <token>transform</token> (.trfm) to open the <token>transform</token> Designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click a <token>transform</token> (.trfm) to open the <token>transform</token> Designer.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab, the following <ui>List</ui> <token>mapop</token>s have two <ui>Behavior</ui> options:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Error Handling</ui> tab, the following <ui>List</ui> <token>mapop</token>s have two <ui>Behavior</ui> options:

trans-unit.source: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent back to the client that sent the message.
trans-unit.target: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent back to the client that sent the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Do not add item into the list</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, the item is not added to the list in the output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Do not add item into the list</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, the item is not added to the list in the output.

trans-unit.source: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent to the client that sent the message.
trans-unit.target: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent to the client that sent the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output Null/Zero/False based on type of output</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, Null/Zero/False is returned as the output based on type of output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output Null/Zero/False based on type of output</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, Null/Zero/False is returned as the output based on type of output.

trans-unit.source: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent back to the client that sent the message.
trans-unit.target: Since <token>transform</token>s are executed within a pipeline, an error occurs within the pipeline and the error is then sent back to the client that sent the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output an empty list</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, an empty list is returned as the output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output an empty list</ui>: If the <token>mapop</token> fails, an empty list is returned as the output.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab, there are three options:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Null/Empty Data Handling</ui> tab, there are three options:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.

trans-unit.source: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of seven.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of seven.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of 10.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> returns a value of 10.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui>: By default, this is not checked.

trans-unit.source: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When not checked, no empty nodes are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.
trans-unit.target: When checked, all nodes, including empty nodes, are included in the iteration.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: there is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: there is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Target Node Generation</ui>: If empty nodes are configured to be considered, you choose to generate an empty node in the output or to not generate an empty node in the output.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Target Node Generation</ui>: If empty nodes are configured to be considered, you choose to generate an empty node in the output or to not generate an empty node in the output.

trans-unit.source: Do not generate empty nodes: Default option.
trans-unit.target: Do not generate empty nodes: Default option.

trans-unit.source: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.
trans-unit.target: EXAMPLE: There is a document with 10 <record> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.
trans-unit.target: Three of these <record> nodes are empty.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui> or <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> are not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Consider empty nodes in cumulative operations</ui> or <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> are not checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates seven times for the non-empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, seven <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.
trans-unit.target: When <ui>Consider empty nodes in iterations</ui> is checked, the <token>mapop</token> iterates 10 times for all nodes, including the empty nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.
trans-unit.target: As a result, 10 <record> nodes are generated in the Target.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Add Item To list</ui> <token>mapop</token> returns an error if the <ui>Create List</ui> <token>mapop</token> is populated <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> assigning inputs to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> operation.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Add Item To list</ui> <token>mapop</token> returns an error if the <ui>Create List</ui> <token>mapop</token> is populated <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> assigning inputs to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> operation.

trans-unit.source: Add a <ui>Create List</ui> to the design area.
trans-unit.target: Add a <ui>Create List</ui> to the design area.

trans-unit.source: Add an <ui>Add Item To list</ui> inside the <ui>Create List</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Add an <ui>Add Item To list</ui> inside the <ui>Create List</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Add an input link to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Add an input link to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Add a member value in the <ui>Create List</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Add a member value in the <ui>Create List</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the input link is added to <ui>Add Item To list</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the input link is added to <ui>Add Item To list</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then, a member value is added to <ui>Create List</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then, a member value is added to <ui>Create List</ui>.

trans-unit.source: When you do this, the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> operation displays error:
trans-unit.target: When you do this, the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> operation displays error:

trans-unit.source: Add Item to List operation labeled <legacyItalic><Name></legacyItalic> should add 1 member(s).
trans-unit.target: Add Item to List operation labeled <legacyItalic><Name></legacyItalic> should add 1 member(s).

trans-unit.source: To work around this behavior, delete the input link to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> and then redraw the link.
trans-unit.target: To work around this behavior, delete the input link to the <ui>Add Item To list</ui> and then redraw the link.
